item.title: Episode Three - A Sequel is Born
item.description: Episode Three The third episode of Glitch Radio is here! This is actually part two to the show I posted last week, but for lack of a better title, I'm going to go ahead and call it episode three. Anyways, this week we round out the story of the Green Monster, and DJ Q. Do they make it home alive? Will WMTU as we know it suffer? Is Glitch Radio Doomed to vanish from the airwaves?! Well, you'll just have to tune in to find out. Additionally, for those of you out there who actually read these long winded descriptions, and visit the webpage, you will notice that the Archival System has been put into place. You can find all the Archived episodes of Glitch now available through filedropper, as well as various other websites. To access the archives, click on the "Archives" link that is available on the bottom of the calendar. From there you will be able to see all the archived episodes of Glitch, Complete with their download link. Additionally, I will be on air TWICE this week, so if you want to tune in live, feel free. The first time will be from 10PM to 1AM Eastern Standard Time on Tuesday, April 29th. Additionally, I will be on air from 12:00PM to 5:00PM Eastern Standard Time on Thursday, May 2nd. These final live broadcasts of Glitch will be turned into an additional 3 episodes, the final two of which will be Glitch Radio's first special broadcast: The Spectrum of Electronic all of which will be available for download from this site. So, once again, and so this section stands out: Listen to Glitch Radio LIVE for it's FINAL two shows! 10PM-1AM EST Tuesday April 29th 12PM-5PM EST Thursday May 2nd Only on WMTU Radio To listen in, click on the 128kbps Stream. Dialup users will be sad to know that the 32kbps stream is broken. Sorry guys, I'm not on the computer crew...(yet) To request music for either of these shows, you can send me an email at glitchradio@comcast.net, OR you can call in, instant message, or send us an e-mail while we are LIVE on air. If you want to choose the latter, simply tune in and wait for a vocal break, we will be giving instructions then. One final thing. I would like to sincerly apologize for the delay with which last week's podcast was posted. Many of you will be suffering this week from the fact that you will be downloading two podcasts instead of one, because you only checked on Monday instead of Tuesday. Once again, I'm quite sorry, and I'll try to get these up on time in the future. Now that we're done with all this administrative stuff, here is the playlist for this week's show: Bond - Highly Strung Darude vs. Robert Miles - The Children of The Sandstorm Fantastic Power! - This is 300 All American Rejects - Swing Swing (DJ Loopy Remix) TF Owned You - Better Off Alone [Remix] Funta - Kao Dekai RaverRose - Burning Love Daft Punk - Around The World Celldweller - Frozen ParagonX9 - Chaos Japan Bond - Hungarian Helblinde - Hardcore Frontiers Cascada - Everytime We Touch [DJ Loopy Remix] Miyavi - Freedom Fighters Konami Kukeihei Club - Burning Heat The Newspaper Boys - Awesome God [Techno Remix] Coda - Longcat's Song Miyavi - Aho Festival K.M.F.D.M. - Touhuvabohu Gunter - Ding Dong Song The Crystal Method - Wild, Sweet, and Cool Machinae Supremacy - Athem Apocolyptica Loli Ripe - Must Mint 23 Heideki Naganuma - The Concept Of Love Korsakoff - City Patrol Jamiroquai - Feels Just Like it Should [Timo Mass Remix] Krafft - Rock Da House Italian Dragon - Moronic Prodigy I Broke My Robot - Take Alphacalm as Directed Machinae Supremacy - Arcade Eiffel 65 - The Edge DJ Sammy - Heaven Fatboy Slim - Weapon of Choice Maximum The Hormone - Zetsubou Billy Korsakoff - My Empty Bottle Infected Mushroom - Becoming Insane ** I would like to apologize for the fact that I was unable to fit the entire Infected Mushroom song into this block. Due to some editing software constraints, my attempt to add it in simply destroyed the edited version of the podcast I was working on, So I decided to just clip the song. I will be playing this again on the favorites show that is coming up, so make sure to tune in to that. Again, sorry for any inconvienence.
item.dc:creator: DJ Universe
item.itunes:summary:
Episode Three
The third episode of Glitch Radio is here!
This is actually part two to the show I posted last week, but for lack of a better title, I'm going to go ahead and call it episode three. Anyways, this week we round out the story of the Green Monster, and DJ Q. Do they make it home alive? Will WMTU as we know it suffer? Is Glitch Radio Doomed to vanish from the airwaves?!
Well, you'll just have to tune in to find out. Additionally, for those of you out there who actually read these long winded descriptions, and visit the webpage, you will notice that the Archival System has been put into place. You can find all the Archived episodes of Glitch now available through filedropper, as well as various other websites. To access the archives, click on the "Archives" link that is available on the bottom of the calendar. From there you will be able to see all the archived episodes of Glitch, Complete with their download link.
Additionally, I will be on air TWICE this week, so if you want to tune in live, feel free. The first time will be from 10PM to 1AM Eastern Standard Time on Tuesday, April 29th. Additionally, I will be on air from 12:00PM to 5:00PM Eastern Standard Time on Thursday, May 2nd. These final live broadcasts of Glitch will be turned into an additional 3 episodes, the final two of which will be Glitch Radio's first special broadcast: The Spectrum of Electronic all of which will be available for download from this site.
So, once again, and so this section stands out: Listen to Glitch Radio LIVE for it's FINAL two shows!
10PM-1AM EST Tuesday April 29th 12PM-5PM EST Thursday May 2nd
Only on WMTU Radio
To listen in, click on the 128kbps Stream. Dialup users will be sad to know that the 32kbps stream is broken. Sorry guys, I'm not on the computer crew...(yet)
To request music for either of these shows, you can send me an email at glitchradio@comcast.net, OR you can call in, instant message, or send us an e-mail while we are LIVE on air. If you want to choose the latter, simply tune in and wait for a vocal break, we will be giving instructions then.
One final thing. I would like to sincerly apologize for the delay with which last week's podcast was posted. Many of you will be suffering this week from the fact that you will be downloading two podcasts instead of one, because you only checked on Monday instead of Tuesday. Once again, I'm quite sorry, and I'll try to get these up on time in the future.
Now that we're done with all this administrative stuff, here is the playlist for this week's show:
Bond - Highly Strung Darude vs. Robert Miles - The Children of The Sandstorm Fantastic Power! - This is 300 All American Rejects - Swing Swing (DJ Loopy Remix) TF Owned You - Better Off Alone [Remix] Funta - Kao Dekai RaverRose - Burning Love Daft Punk - Around The World Celldweller - Frozen ParagonX9 - Chaos Japan Bond - Hungarian Helblinde - Hardcore Frontiers Cascada - Everytime We Touch [DJ Loopy Remix] Miyavi - Freedom Fighters Konami Kukeihei Club - Burning Heat The Newspaper Boys - Awesome God [Techno Remix] Coda - Longcat's Song Miyavi - Aho Festival K.M.F.D.M. - Touhuvabohu Gunter - Ding Dong Song The Crystal Method - Wild, Sweet, and Cool Machinae Supremacy - Athem Apocolyptica Loli Ripe - Must Mint 23 Heideki Naganuma - The Concept Of Love Korsakoff - City Patrol Jamiroquai - Feels Just Like it Should [Timo Mass Remix] Krafft - Rock Da House Italian Dragon - Moronic Prodigy I Broke My Robot - Take Alphacalm as Directed Machinae Supremacy - Arcade Eiffel 65 - The Edge DJ Sammy - Heaven Fatboy Slim - Weapon of Choice Maximum The Hormone - Zetsubou Billy Korsakoff - My Empty Bottle Infected Mushroom - Becoming Insane
** I would like to apologize for the fact that I was unable to fit the entire Infected Mushroom song into this block. Due to some editing software constraints, my attempt to add it in simply destroyed the edited version o(continued)

item.title: Episode Two - Will there be... a SEQUEL?!
item.description:
The second episode of Glitch Radio is now available! This episode actually took place through another nine hour long block of Glitch Radio. The nine hours is a definate plus, because this is the last week that WMTU will be transmitting, and as such, the last OFFICIAL week for Glitch. However, What I have decided to do is split the nine hour long block into three, three hour shows, which I will post over the next couple weeks. These two additional shows, combined with a separate 3 hour long sub slot I did, and the special Final Exam edition of Glitch Radio, should keep the podcasts rolling in for the next four weeks.
I would also like to apologize for my delay in getting this posted. It is the final week before exams, so I've been a little bit bogged down. However, We tried to do something new during this episode, the results of which you will soon hear. At the end of it you may be wondering "Christ! What the hell just happened?!" and to that, I simply reply that you will have to wait until next week's post to find out. Furthermore, no members of WMTU were harmed in the making of this broadcast.
Enjoy the show! Here's this weeks playlist.
Eiffel 65 - Europop Caramell - Caramelldancen Crazy Loop - Crazy Loop (Mm-ma-ma) DJ Icey - Castles in the Sky Punkrockerz - Punkrocker Oomph! - Traumst Du Digital Droo - Monkey Developers Bond - Explosive Andrew W.K. - Party Hard Haddaway - What is Love DJ Anonymous - So I Herd You Liek Musics Rammstein Feat Alec Empire - Amerika [Digital Hardcore Mix] Manish - Series of Tubes Bond - Samba 2PM - Tetris Trance Remix REDAliCE - Motteke! Sailor Fuku Portal - Still Alive Aphex Twin - Come to Daddy [Pappy Mix] HouseMasta - Tetris [Dirty Remix] RageVI - Tailspin Tetris Stage 3-1 - The Legend of Zelda K.M.F.D.M. - These Boots are Made for Walkin DJ Sharpnel - Pretty Green Onions RaverRose - Star (Long Edit) Celldweller - Switchback DarkMateria - The Picard Song Lazy Town - You are a Pirate Aqua - Candyman m477zorz - Break the Targets 2
Also, just so you guys are aware, this episode of Glitch has destroyed what little remaining storage space that I have left on Podomatic, and because of this, each subsequent post will require me to archive one previous podcast, starting, of course, with the earliest. However, never fear, they will be archived and available for download through a file hosting site such as mediafire or rapidshare. Just wanted to give you guys a heads up.

item.title: Episode One
item.description: The first OFFICIAL episode of Glitch Radio has arrived! It's not another sub show, no this one is a full three hour helping of Glitch Radio brought to you by WMTU 91.9FM Houghton. While we regret to inform you that we are without wacky interviews this week, I am happy to say that we had an additionaly radio personality in the studio with us. Lucas stayed the entire show, which was nice because DJ PolarBear has fallen ill this week. As for the music, I attempted to put together a playlist that could best be described as ordered chaos. Unfortunately, Winamp promptly ate this playlist, and the end result is this week's show, which turned out very well. As usual, you can find the playlist at the bottom of this post. There have been some slight alterations to the way the show is handled, especially in the podcast processing section. If you couldn't tell, the last post was a bit rough around the edges, and I am working on cleaning it up. Additionally, the podcast page itself will be changing in the upcoming future. However, These edits will be made slowly depending on when I have the time to enact them. As always, feel free to contact me with any comments, suggestions, hate mail, or requests for next weeks show. You know how much I love hearing from you. If you are more interested in finding out about the contest, feel free to contact me. Also, expect further changes in the way Glitch Radio is handled, as I continue to get better at this. I'm currently looking at reducing podcast length, or creating two different podcast streams. If you have any ideas, feel free to contact me at the address above. Infected Mushroom - The Missed Symphony The Newspaper Boys - Awesome God [Techno Remix] Saltillo - A Hair on the Head of John the Baptist The Avalanches - Frontier Psychiatrist Eiffel 65 - Europop I Broke My Robot - The Further Away The All-American Rejects - Swing Swing [DJ Loopy Remix] Bond - Samba The Pet Shop Boys - Absolutely Fabulous Andrew W.K. - Party Hard Fatboy Slim - I See You Baby [Groove Armada Mix] Oomph! - Traumst Du? Halcali - Tandem Rammstein - Amerika [Digital Hardcore Remix by Alec Empire] 2PM - Tetris [Trance Remix] 2Unlimited - Twilight Zone [PK Hard Trance Mix] DJ B.A.R. - The CS Instrumental Halcali - Electric Sensei [Electric Body Sensei Remix] The Aphex Twin - Come To Daddy [Pappy Remix] Darude v. Robert Miles - Children of The Sandstorm Bond - Hungarian Fatboy Slim - Weapon of Choice DJ Sharpnel - Understyle DJ Yousuke - Untitled I Broke My Robot - Not so Fast, You're Hurting Me Basshunter - Strand Tylosand Crazy Loop - Crazy Loop (Mm-ma-ma) DJ B.A.R. - CS Firedance Mindless Self Indulgence - Shut Me Up Punkrockerz - Punkrocker Eiffel 65 - Living in a Bubble Jimmy James - Fashionista Rammstein - Das Model Fatboy Slim - The Rockafeller Skank CarboHydroM - Final Fantasy VII Boss Battle [Overclocked Remix]
item.dc:creator: DJ Universe
item.itunes:summary:
The first OFFICIAL episode of Glitch Radio has arrived!
It's not another sub show, no this one is a full three hour helping of Glitch Radio brought to you by WMTU 91.9FM Houghton. While we regret to inform you that we are without wacky interviews this week, I am happy to say that we had an additionaly radio personality in the studio with us. Lucas stayed the entire show, which was nice because DJ PolarBear has fallen ill this week.
As for the music, I attempted to put together a playlist that could best be described as ordered chaos. Unfortunately, Winamp promptly ate this playlist, and the end result is this week's show, which turned out very well. As usual, you can find the playlist at the bottom of this post.
There have been some slight alterations to the way the show is handled, especially in the podcast processing section. If you couldn't tell, the last post was a bit rough around the edges, and I am working on cleaning it up. Additionally, the podcast page itself will be changing in the upcoming future. However, These edits will be made slowly depending on when I have the time to enact them.
As always, feel free to contact me with any comments, suggestions, hate mail, or requests for next weeks show. You know how much I love hearing from you. If you are more interested in finding out about the contest, feel free to contact me. Also, expect further changes in the way Glitch Radio is handled, as I continue to get better at this. I'm currently looking at reducing podcast length, or creating two different podcast streams. If you have any ideas, feel free to contact me at the address above.
